definition[0]: to move quickly to avoid someone or something
example[0]: He ran across the courtyard, dodging a storm of bullets.
example[1]: Helen clutched Edwardâ€™s arm as they dodged through the traffic.
definition[1]: to deliberately avoid discussing something or doing something
note[1]: draft dodging (=when someone avoids an order to join the army, navy etc)
example[2]: Senator O'Brian skillfully dodged the crucial question.
definition[2]: something dishonest that is done to avoid a rule or law
example[3]: Businesses are investing in tree plantations as a tax dodge  (=a way of avoiding paying tax).
definition[3]: a type of US car made by Chrysler
definition[4]: to deliberately avoid doing something, especially paying for something
example[5]: We suspected they were dodging VAT and alerted Customs and Excise.
example[6]: ways in which the tobacco industry had dodged bans on advertising
